<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ThreadSanitizer: instrument the code in module to find races.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Instantiating ThreadSanitizer inserts the tsan runtime library API function</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">/// declarations into the module if they don&#39;t exist already. Instantiating</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ensures the &#95;&#95;tsan&#95;init function is in the list of global constructors for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the module.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-threadsanitizer-cpp-/threadsanitizer"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-threadsanitizer-cpp-/threadsanitizer/#a6ea2c96858c1b7f09b578dbb8761fae9">ThreadSanitizer</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-threadsanitizer-cpp-/threadsanitizer/#a6ea2c96858c1b7f09b578dbb8761fae9"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-threadsanitizer-cpp-/threadsanitizer/#a6ea2c96858c1b7f09b578dbb8761fae9">ThreadSanitizer</a>() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Instrumenting some of the accesses may be proven redundant.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Currently handled:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  - read-before-write (within same BB, no calls between)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  - not captured variables</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We do not handle some of the patterns that should not survive</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// after the classic compiler optimizations.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00679" /><CodeLine lineNumber="679"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00680" /><CodeLine lineNumber="680"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If a memset intrinsic gets inlined by the code gen, we will miss races on it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00681" /><CodeLine lineNumber="681"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// So, we either need to ensure the intrinsic is not inlined, or instrument it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00682" /><CodeLine lineNumber="682"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We do not instrument memset/memmove/memcpy intrinsics (too complicated),</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00683" /><CodeLine lineNumber="683"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instead we simply replace them with regular function calls, which are then</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00684" /><CodeLine lineNumber="684"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// intercepted by the run-time.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00685" /><CodeLine lineNumber="685"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Since tsan is running after everyone else, the calls should not be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00686" /><CodeLine lineNumber="686"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// replaced back with intrinsics. If that becomes wrong at some point,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00687" /><CodeLine lineNumber="687"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we will need to call e.g. &#95;&#95;tsan&#95;memset to avoid the intrinsics.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00688" /><CodeLine lineNumber="688"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ThreadSanitizer::instrumentMemIntrinsic(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="699"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memtransferinst">MemTransferInst</a> &#42;M = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;MemTransferInst&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="709"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="710"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Both llvm and ThreadSanitizer atomic operations are based on C++11/C1x</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="711"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// standards.  For background see C++11 standard.  A slightly older, publicly</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="712"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// available draft of the standard (not entirely up-to-date, but close enough</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="713"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for casual browsing) is available here:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="714"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg21/docs/papers/2011/n3242.pdf</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="715"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The following page contains more background information:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="716"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// http://www.hpl.hp.com/personal/Hans&#95;Boehm/c++mm/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="717"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
